intro: Silene heterodonta var. platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-calyx evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is notable for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its attractive floral display.
